result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Kaleta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Kaleta in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 2. Court conducts plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Count 1
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to any other sentence
- 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. 

 Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  

Count 2
- 30 days Huber with standard release conditions to commence by July 20, 2015 by 6:00 pm. 

 Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael J Kaleta in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's motion to suppress.  State calls Officer Kyle Becker to the stand.  Officer Becker sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and redirect examination.  State rests. Defense rests.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court denies defendant's motion to suppress.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
evidence with memorandum in support of motion filed by Attorney Kuhary.
Motion hearing on May 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court.   Defendant Michael J Kaleta did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defense expects to file motions within 2 weeks.  Defense to file motions by 5/1/15.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Michael J Kaleta in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
